titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Type Specimens
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Melissa Quinones

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Winterhouse Art and Design collection of type specimens
did.abstract: The collection comprises type specimens collected by William Drenttel and Jessica Helfand in the course of their work as principals of Winterhouse Design and later Winterhouse Institute.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William Drenttel and Jessica Helfand, 2013.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Type Specimens, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Winterhouse was a design consultancy founded by partners William Drenttel and Jessica Helfand. According to their website, "Winterhouse Studio focuse[d] on editorial development and online media; cultural and educational institutions; and social innovation initiatives... Winterhouse Institute focuse[d] on non-profit, self-initiated projects that support design education as well as social and political initiatives."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises type specimens collected by William Drenttel and Jessica Helfand in the course of their work as principals of Winterhouse Design and later Winterhouse Institute.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by manufacturer/publisher and then chronologically by date of publication.

did.unittitle: Emigre Fonts: the stuff that words are made of

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three copies, including one with a dust jacket, and one poster.

did.unittitle: Emigre presents the typography of Elliott Peter Earls at the Apollo Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two copies of the 1999 edition.

scopecontent.p: Includes several loose sheets in a gray folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This item is a catalog published in conjunction with the exhibition "Jack Stauffacher, Printer," which was held at the Natalie & James Thompson Art Gallery, School of Art and Design, San Jose State University, 23 February to 26 March, 1999.
